title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Theories of Law, Schools of Jurisprudence- relevancy, limitations, contribution to the development of law and legal institutions, Contemporary understanding of positivism and natural law, Law as practice of the court, Jurimetrics, Law and Science, Law and Society, Law as a synthesis of order and justice, law and the enforcement of morals-Critical Legal Studies Movement, Critical Race Theory, Feminist Legal Theory, Theory of Justice and Minimalist State. Judicial process in pursuit of Constitutional goals and values- Law of Precedent-New dimensions of judicial activism and structural challenges – Institutional liability of Courts and judicial activism-Scope and limits, Reference:1.Julius Stone, The Province and Function of Law, (2000), Universal New Delhi. 2.Cardozo, The Nature of Judicial Process (1995), Universal, New Delhi3.Prof. Michael Freeman, Lloyds Introduction to Jurisprudence, (2014), Sweet and Maxwell.4.Murphy Mark C, An Essay on Divine Authority (Cornell Studies in the Philosophy of Religion), (2002), Cornell University Press.5.A.Laxminath, Precedent in Indian Law: Judicial Process, (2012) Eastern Book Company.
